channel.title: Ruby on chischaschos rocks
channel.description: Recent content in Ruby on chischaschos rocks

item.title: Lessons learned from creating a postgresql data playground
item.description: Objective Create a script that produces a postgresql database. The structure will be fixed and the contents of the db may vary. The shape of the data should be mostly the same so that every time I rebuild the db I can expect similar queries across rebuilds to output similar data. End result This world is built and feed with fake-messaging-app-pg. I expect to keep changing it but I can call the first iteration completed.

item.title: Debugging guard-jasmine error
item.description: Motivation I’m working on a project that uses guard-jasmine (1.19.2). For a number reasons I can’t upgrade it yet. This morning the test headless test suite started failing with: âžœ bundle exec guard-jasmine Guard::Jasmine starts Unicorn spec server on port 58583 in test environment (coverage off). Waiting for Jasmine test runner at http://localhost:58583/jasmine Run all Jasmine suites Run Jasmine suite at http://localhost:58583/jasmine 2016-09-27 22:01:55.025 phantomjs[3242:3209481] *** WARNING: Method userSpaceScaleFactor in class NSView is deprecated on 10.

item.title: Resque and Sidekiq as of August 2016
item.description: Motivation Some months ago, at an interview I got asked this: What would you use resque or sidekiq and why? My answer was something along the lines of: Sidekiq consumes less memory, so that sounds better. Both Resque and Sidekiq are stable and widely used in production. I’ve used Resque in a 3 applications, two of them are still running and processing tons of background jobs. Before making my choice I would need to know the kind of background processing that we would do.
